questiontext.text:
Use Laplace transforms to solve the following differential equation given that y = 3 and dy/dt = 5 at t = 0:

$$ \small 3\frac{d^2 y}{d t^2} + 7\frac{dy}{dt} + 4y = 25exp(-4t) $$
Find the Laplace Transforms table here.

generalfeedback.text:
Taking laplace transform of both sides:
$$ \small =>3[ s^2Y(s) - \frac{dy}{dt}(0) - sy(0)] +7[sY(s) - y(0)] +4[Y(s)] = \frac{25}{s +4} $$
$$ \small =>3[ s^2Y(s) -5 - s(3)] +7[sY(s) -3] +4[Y(s)] = \frac{25}{s +4} $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) [3s^2 +7s +4] = \frac{25}{s +4} + s(9) +36 $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{3\, s^2 + 72\, s + 169}{\left(s + 4\right)\, \left(3\, s^2 + 7\, s + 4\right)} $$
By splitting the partial fractions,
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{100}{3\, \left(s + 1\right)} - \frac{71}{24\, \left(s + 4\right)} - \frac{705}{8\, \left(3\, s + 4\right)} $$
Rewritting the above to match forms on the Laplace Transforms table and taking the inverse laplace,
$$ \small =>\frac{100\, \mathrm{e}^{- t}}{3} - \frac{71\, \mathrm{e}^{- 4\, t}}{24} - \frac{235\, \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{4\, t}{3}}}{8} $$

questiontext.text:

Find the Laplace Transforms table here.

generalfeedback.text:

$$ \small =>3[ s^2Y(s) - \frac{dy}{dt}(0) - sy(0)] +9[sY(s) - y(0)] +2[Y(s)] = \frac{20}{s +2} $$
$$ \small =>3[ s^2Y(s) -4 - s()] +9[sY(s) -] +2[Y(s)] = \frac{20}{s +2} $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) [3s^2 +9s +2] = \frac{20}{s +2} + s(3) +21 $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{s^2 + 27\, s + 62}{\left(s + 2\right)\, \left(3\, s^2 + 9\, s + 2\right)} $$
By splitting the partial fractions,
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{10\, s + 34}{3\, s^2 + 9\, s + 2} - \frac{3}{s + 2} $$
Rewritting the above to match forms on the Laplace Transforms table and taking the inverse laplace,
$$ \small =>\frac{10\, \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{3\, t}{2}}\, \left(\cosh\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{3}\, \sqrt{19}\, t}{6}\right) + \frac{\sqrt{3}\, \sqrt{19}\, \sinh\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{3}\, \sqrt{19}\, t}{6}\right)}{5}\right)}{3} - 3\, \mathrm{e}^{- 2\, t} $$

$$ \small 4\frac{d^2 y}{d t^2} + 7\frac{dy}{dt} + y = 25exp(-3t) $$
Find the Laplace Transforms table here.

generalfeedback.text:
Taking laplace transform of both sides:
$$ \small =>4[ s^2Y(s) - \frac{dy}{dt}(0) - sy(0)] +7[sY(s) - y(0)] +[Y(s)] = \frac{25}{s +3} $$
$$ \small =>4[ s^2Y(s) -6 - s(3)] +7[sY(s) -3] +[Y(s)] = \frac{25}{s +3} $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) [4s^2 +7s +] = \frac{25}{s +3} + s(12) +45 $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{3\, s^2 + 81\, s + 160}{\left(s + 3\right)\, \left(4\, s^2 + 7\, s + 1\right)} $$
By splitting the partial fractions,
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{17\, s + \frac{109}{2}}{4\, s^2 + 7\, s + 1} - \frac{7}{2\, \left(s + 3\right)} $$
Rewritting the above to match forms on the Laplace Transforms table and taking the inverse laplace,
$$ \small =>\frac{17\, \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{7\, t}{8}}\, \left(\cosh\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{33}\, t}{8}\right) + \frac{317\, \sqrt{33}\, \sinh\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{33}\, t}{8}\right)}{561}\right)}{4} - \frac{7\, \mathrm{e}^{- 3\, t}}{2} $$

questiontext.text:

Find the Laplace Transforms table here.

generalfeedback.text:
Taking laplace transform of both sides:
$$ \small =>2[ s^2Y(s) - \frac{dy}{dt}(0) - sy(0)] +6[sY(s) - y(0)] +7[Y(s)] = \frac{29}{s +5} $$
$$ \small =>2[ s^2Y(s) -4 - s()] +6[sY(s) -] +7[Y(s)] = \frac{29}{s +5} $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) [2s^2 +6s +7] = \frac{29}{s +5} + s(2) +14 $$
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{s^2 + 24\, s + 99}{\left(s + 5\right)\, \left(2\, s^2 + 6\, s + 7\right)} $$
By splitting the partial fractions,
$$ \small =>Y(s) =\frac{4}{27\, \left(s + 5\right)} + \frac{\frac{19\, s}{27} + \frac{529}{27}}{2\, s^2 + 6\, s + 7} $$
Rewritting the above to match forms on the Laplace Transforms table and taking the inverse laplace,
$$ \small =>\frac{4\, \mathrm{e}^{- 5\, t}}{27} + \frac{19\, \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{3\, t}{2}}\, \left(\cos\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{5}\, t}{2}\right) + \frac{1001\, \sqrt{5}\, \sin\!\left(\frac{\sqrt{5}\, t}{2}\right)}{95}\right)}{54} $$
